Blind guess: Japanese?

And you've only gone and hit the target!

Explanation:

Up and down, or left and right, - Japanese can be written either vertically or horizontally

Mix and match, - Kanji, Hiragana, and Katakana scripts, and the Roman alphabet, sometimes all in a single sentence.

but be polite. - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_honorifics

Loaned for eyes, owned for ears - Written Kanji are of Chinese origin, but the spoken words are mostly native to Japan.

Still the origin's unclear. - The origin of Japanese and its relation to other languages.

Away from home not often found, - It's not that widely spoken outside its home country, unlike say English or Spanish.

Though in Hawaii there's its sound. - Something like 5-10% of Hawaii residents speak Japanese

On the net sometimes a mess, - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mojibake and other display issues aren't uncommon with Japanese text.

That's all your clues, so take a guess. - Filler line.

Thank goodness I've finally seen the answer! This one was threatening to deprive me of sleep!

-Slashy
Wow. That's just... just... wow. Impressive even. Sherlock would be stumped.
Well, that makes perfect sense. Well written riddle, cantab.

Indeed, it was well written.

Hawaii, Pearl Harbor, Japanese...Japanese are said to be polite as far as I remember. It was worth a guess, obviously.

New riddle:

Everyone has me

And everyone knows it

Though some want to hide me

Or try not to show it

Some wish I was smaller

Or even stopped growing

But in truth they want me

To increase without slowing.

Everyone has me
